data.title: Unable to copy all text in debug console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Win 10 x64 pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a python file that contains the following lines:

```
for i in range(100):
    print i
```
1. Debug it (F5).
2. Try selecting the output from the debug console, you will notice that when 'ctrl+c' it, only 10 lines or so get copied.

Any ideas?

data.title: Import translations into 1.6 release branch
data.body:
VSCode Version: 1.6.0

Title says it all.

data.title: HTML word definition changed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version:

The refactoring that turned the HTML/Razor/Handlebar mode into an extension modified the word regexp (copy paste from the JSON mode).

Before:
html & handlebars: `/(-?\d*\.\d\w*)|([^\\`~!\@\$^&*()\=+[{]}\|\;:\'\"\,.<>\/\s]+)/g`
razor:`/(-?\d_.\d\w_)|([^`~!\@\$^&*()-\=+[{]}\|\;:\'\"\,.<>\/\s]+)/g`

The word reg exp is used for:
Populating the find widget, word proposals, intellisense replace positions.

data.title: New update broke Markdown preview zoom
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:37:40.189Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: ms-vscode.cpptools-0.8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Markdown file.
2. Click Preview icon.
3. Use `Ctrl+=` a few times to zoom -- the child window dimensions don't scale properly, the text gets bigger but the area in which it's shown gets smaller and smaller.

data.title: Track highlights across multiple split editors
data.body:
Can you add mode to Split Editor when highlighted selection of one half also highlights on another?
For example, on left half you can have list of some special words. You can just select them one by one and quickly find all places where they are on right half.

thank you.

data.title: diff view for large files scroll to wrong position when click on diff map panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.0 (e52fb0bc87e6f5c8f144e172639891d8d8c9aa55, 2016-10-10T18:37:40.189Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: donjayamanne.githistory-0.1.0, formulahendry.code-runner-0.3.4, slevesque.vscode-hexdump-1.0.0, waderyan.gitblame-1.3.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. edit any large text file (15000+ lines)
2. Git / open diff view for modified file
3. click on any place of diff map panel (where we can see red/green bars)

Expected: New scroll position = position of bottom part highlighted zone of diff panel.

Actual: New scroll position = position of bottom part of scroll bar. Visually it looks like I click on scrollbar of "diff map panel", but scroll work like I click on real scrollbar, which is on nearest but another panel.

data.title: Unable to run Node in integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64 with Anniversary Update

Steps to Reproduce:
1. install nvm-windows and use it to install any version of Node.js
2. open integrated terminal in VSCode
3. type node to invoke Node

Expected outcome would be that the Node CLI starts. 
Instead the terminal is unable to recognize node as a command (works in regular cmd windows, both elevated and regular)
The PATH Environment variable in the integrated terminal contains unresolved references to Environment variables %NVM_HOME%;%NVM_SYMLINK%;

When examining Environment variables these are set correctly within the integrated terminal 
NVM_HOME=C:\Users\Anders\AppData\Roaming\nvm
NVM_SYMLINK=C:\Program Files\nodejs

Is the integrated terminal interpreting environment variables differently that the regular cmd Shell in Windows?

data.title: Unable to debug extensions when being offline
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: windows7

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Create a vscode extension project.
2.  Pull off the cable to keep offine.
3.  Launch Extension (F5)

I can`t set breakpoint in my source file. 
And I find some warn information in Extension Development Host Window :

```
[Extension Host] Could not find a free port for debugging
```

I change the code in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/node/ports.ts#L61

`client.connect(startPort, '127.0.0.1');`

It`s works.   fyi  @vscodeteam.

data.title: We would like to get an event when the user clicks on the suggest-widget doc-details icon
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.7.0

We would like to have telemetry when user clicks on the doc-details icon in the suggestion window. 
To do that we request to expose an event when the detail documentation is shown.

data.title: Tab drawing glitch when icons are enabled and kick in later
data.body:
OS: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14942]
Version 1.7.0-insider
Commit 5dd716eaedc5a239379013863568c7f7dea708a5
Date 2016-10-13T08:02:00.080Z
Shell 1.3.7
Renderer 52.0.2743.82
Node 6.5.0

![Tab Length Issue](http://i.imgur.com/qYpzaG2.png)

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open a Folder
2.  Create a file with a long name.
3.  Save the file.
4. Close VS Code
5. Launch VS Code

Note: Selecting another tab forces VS Code to correctly re-evaluate the length.

data.title: Make it easier to navigate to files/folders in explorer by typing their name
data.body:
[feature-request]

In the file explorer, typing the name of a file should take you to that file, just like it does in Windows explorer.

![vscodefrexplorer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2523987/19346628/16b4bd96-9162-11e6-887c-a222b233cca8.png)

data.title: Improve VS Code when working with network drives

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Some issues impact users that try to run VS Code against slow network drives. Specifically:
- [ ] some folders fail to open or display (#26931, #20207, #21397, #21520, #25885)
- [ ] when opening an already opened file, we load its metadata to find out if it changed
- [ ] we remove folders from the recent folders list when they do not seem to exist even though they are ([13699](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13699))
- [x] when opening an already opened file, we open it to detect the encoding (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21604)
- [x] we close an editor when we detect a file delete event (this can happen from faulty file events) (#11642)
- [x] we prevent saving when we think the contents on disk are newer (which seems to happen sporadically on network drives) (#18037)

data.title: --disable-direct-write stopped working

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  add `--disable-direct-write` when starting vscode

Related: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=579678

This behaviour makes vscode unusable for me as I work with clear type disabled and use Courier New as font to get pixel perfect font rendering (at least that's how it was before 1.6). All font rendering in vscode is now blurry. I have a standard dpi display (~96dpi).

![screenshot of vscode 1.6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/530988/19344829/0d7a0ffe-913c-11e6-81ca-dd6f2f0a8cee.PNG)

EDIT: I downgraded to 1.5.3 now. Nice crisp fonts again...

![screenshot of vscode 1.5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/530988/19345679/c12e1498-913f-11e6-9b05-a8faf6ea4de1.PNG)

data.title: Search in selection keeps turning itself on
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.0-insider (1.7.0-insider) (1889442ff090ef8170814a98698506300962dbba)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Whenever I hit `cmd+f` the `search in selection` is enabled, regardless if I have a selection active or not. See this or demonstration: http://recordit.co/G1a8RveXgL (I'm hiding the search box with `esc`). It's making search practically unusable for me.

data.title: Cycle trough previous searches
data.body:
One feature I miss dearly from sublime is it's ability to remember my previous searches. So I can open the search box (either global or file) and press up/down and cycle trough things I've searched for before (same for other fields in the global search).

Is this something you guys are planning on implementing?

data.title: VS Code - Tabs reload when switching between them
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Windows 10
- Plugins: Python , C#

Every time I switch tabs on VS Code the content of the tab is being reloaded. It might not be a problem when developing on local machine, but I'm connected to a remote a machine using WinSShFS.

Can I cache the file locally and only access the remote server on save and first load?

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Connect to a remote linux server using WinSshFS
2. Open  a folder 
3. Open a file and than another file
4. Switch between the tabs

data.title: Debugger completion inserted wrong
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-insider

Assuming we have these variables:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10532611/19341626/72eb1ca6-912e-11e6-9fb3-c1a332f914ac.png)

I'm typing `$aBoo` into the debug console and want to get completion to `$aBoolean`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10532611/19341667/a7724be8-912e-11e6-874b-0438554d833e.png)

Notice how the `$` is not highlighted. 

The debug adapter responds correctly with:

``` js
targets: [
  { label: '$aBoolean', length: 9, start: 0, type: 'variable' }
]
```

As you can see it even specifies that the completion should be inserted at the beginning of the console.

After hitting enter:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10532611/19341750/164d8672-912f-11e6-9251-d165185dbd7e.png)

$ is duplicated.

data.title: updateUserConfiguration: does not trigger for workspace changes
data.body: I noticed a new updateUserConfiguration telemetry event which does not seem to get triggered when workspace settings are changed. Imho it would be better to have 1 thing listening on changes to user and workspace settings and report the proper telemetry for it. This would also help for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13652

data.title: Do not use setter injection for services
data.body:
I noticed that the configurationService is now getting the telemetry service injected via set method. This is against our typical rules of constructor injection and should be avoided. Please find another solution for logging changes to the configuration file, possibly by some guy on top listening to file changes and logging the related telemetry.

Related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13653
